heading: Core Function: DNA Synthesis
text: fundamental reaction catalyzed DNA polymerases addition deoxyribonucleotide (dNTP) 3’-hydroxyl (-OH) end pre-existing polynucleotide strand (primer). reaction forms phosphodiester bond:Template Reading: polymerase reads template DNA strand determine nucleotide add next (following Watson-Crick base pairing rules: T, G C)Nucleotide Selection: selects complementary dNTP (dATP, dGTP, dCTP, dTTP) surrounding environmentBond Formation: catalyzes nucleophilic attack 3’-OH group primer strand alpha-phosphate incoming dNTP. forms phosphodiester bond releases pyrophosphate (PPi)Directionality: Synthesis ALWAYS proceeds 5’ → 3’ direction. polymerase moves along template strand reading 3’ → 5’ direction

heading: Reverse Rranscriptase
text: Reverse Transcriptase (RT): remarkable enzyme, famously employed retroviruses like HIV, flips central dogma synthesizing DNA copy (cDNA) RNA template. unique RNA-dependent DNA polymerase activity makes RT absolutely indispensable clinical molecular lab, enabling us capture analyze information stored RNA molecules – like viral genomes gene expression levels – using robust DNA-based techniques PCRThink molecular “translator” even bit “molecular time machine” – takes RNA message converts back stable, double-stranded DNA format

heading: Core Function: RNA-Dependent DNA Synthesis
text: defining characteristic Reverse Transcriptase ability synthesize DNA strand (called complementary DNA cDNA) using RNA molecule template. reverse usual transcription process (DNA → RNA)

heading: Key Enzymatic Activities
text: reverse transcriptases possess three distinct enzymatic activities, working together achieve RNA--dsDNA conversion:RNA-Dependent DNA Polymerase Activity: primary function. reads RNA template (3’ → 5’) synthesizes complementary DNA strand (5’ → 3’) using dNTPsRNase H (Ribonuclease H) Activity: activity specifically degrades RNA strand within RNA:DNA hybrid molecule. first cDNA strand made, original RNA template mostly removed activity, allowing second DNA strand synthesizedDNA-Dependent DNA Polymerase Activity: first cDNA strand made RNA template (mostly) removed, enzyme uses newly synthesized cDNA strand template create second, complementary DNA strand, resulting double-stranded cDNA molecule

heading: Biological Origin
text: Reverse transcriptases aren’t found organisms. famously associated :Retroviruses: Viruses like HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus), HTLV (Human T-lymphotropic Virus), lentiviruses used gene therapy vectors. viruses RNA genome. Upon infecting host cell, use RT convert RNA genome dsDNA, integrates host cell’s genomeRetrotransposons: Mobile genetic elements within eukaryotic genomes replicate via RNA intermediate using RTTelomerase: specialized cellular reverse transcriptase maintains ends (telomeres) eukaryotic chromosomes, using internal RNA template

Used detect specific proteins. (Focus course nucleic acids, good know analogy)
